name: Aluminum Multiple Choice Quiz | Chemistry | 5 Questions

questions.text: From which ore is aluminum extracted?
Which isotope of aluminum is stable (i.e. not radioactive)?
questions.explanation:
Al-27.

	Al-26 has a half-life of 730000 years and Al-28's is 2.3 minutes.

questions.text: Aluminum is the most abundant metal in the Earth's crust.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Aluminum is the most abundant metal to be found in the Earth's crust (8.1 percent), but is never found free in nature.

questions.text: Outside of the United States, aluminum is called aluminium.
questions.explanation:
True.

	The name aluminium was adopted to conform with the 'ium' ending of most elements, and this spelling is now in use elsewhere in the world. Aluminium was also the accepted spelling in the U.S. until 1925, at which time the American Chemical Society officially decided to use the name aluminum thereafter in their publications.
